Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez passed a specific act, when in reality she had not sponsored any bills related to textbooks or Robert E. Lee at the time of the claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the assertion that Ocasio-Cortez passed the mentioned act.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Ocasio-Cortez has the power to pass legislation on her own, which is a problematic assumption as members of Congress can only propose legislation and it requires a process for a bill to become law.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Ocasio-Cortez had not sponsored any bills related to textbooks or Robert E. Lee at the time of the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide alternative explanations or consider other possible reasons for the absence of any mention of Robert E. Lee in school textbooks.
